column1: As we continue our fight against the COVID-19 pandemic I look forward to working further on the upward momentum from the last four years.

#Crapo4YearHighlight: The Foreign Investment Risk Review Modernization Act also reauthorized the Defense Production Act of 1950 for 6 years which was utilized in producing needed materials in addressing the COVID19 pandemic.

#DomesticViolenceAwarenessMonth unites advocates across the nation in their efforts to end domestic violence. Throughout COVID-19 Congress has provided reassurance that no matter what is going on in the world there are places you can go for help. https://t.co/DBJhUTFFKI

ATTENTION IDAHOANS: COVID-19 cases continue to rise in Idaho. The best way forward is to keep up with efforts that will flatten the uptick in cases in the region like staying home when sick wearing a mask washing your hands and covering your cough or sneeze.

The #CARESAct was Phase 3 of Congress’ response to the COVID-19 pandemic and included direct payments to Americans small business relief and health care support. https://t.co/MUkTKCLedu https://t.co/GC1qzF4uc5

#Crapo4YearHIghlight: In March of this year Congress passed and the Administration signed into law the #CARESAct which provided major economic relief to the American people to help bolster the nation’s response to the coronavirus. https://t.co/0rIg4BZPcU

The COVID-19 pandemic has provided a stark reminder that one of the most effective ways to stop the spread of many viruses is also one of the simplest--hand hygiene. #GlobalHandwashingDay https://t.co/ywfuuzFBTY

✅Small Biz Assistance ✅Unemployment Insurance ✅Health Care Funds ✅Ag and Farmer assistance @SenateGOP offered billions of dollars in COVID relief. The Democrats filibustered and wouldn’t come to the table. https://t.co/ODUp6uvfKd

Did you miss my newsletter yesterday morning? Sign up to receive my newsletter as I share up-to-date information on the USPS and the Senate's action to combat #COVID19 https://t.co/4M0aSt67WO https://t.co/x6yU12O69b
#ICYMI: My column this week focuses on Covid-19 effects on the postal service. (via: @TheIdahoPress) https://t.co/OreSEk6K1t https://t.co/j6S8IvKlSU

Blood centers throughout the country have experienced a significant drop in donations due to #COVID19. If you're healthy your blood donation is needed. Thank you to all the nurses and volunteers. We're all in this together!
The Paycheck Protection Program was designed specifically to help American workers and their small business employers weather the economic storm caused by the global coronavirus pandemic.
The $10.9 million in CARES Act funding to small businesses across Idaho will help revitalize small rural communities adversely affected by the coronavirus pandemic.
Thank you @AARPIdaho for inviting @governorLittle Director Jeppesen of @IDHW and me for a Live Q and A on the #CoronavirusPandemic https://t.co/qUpTQ3oG85
Great news! I sent a letter to @POTUS last week about this very issue. @IDNationalGuard has been an incredible asset in our fight against #coronavirus. https://t.co/Je9mSQnYkz
Today eligible farmers and ranchers can begin submitting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program administered by @USDA.
The @USNationalGuard has been critical in executing the nation’s #COVID19 response efforts. We must ensure they are kept safe healthy and receive the benefits they deserve. https://t.co/Wj6gyVJq3f

New stats show we are turning the corner regarding the numbers of those being tested. The U.S. has conducted over 7 million tests—more than elsewhere in the world. Daily test numbers continue to rise and will help us effectively combat #COVID19 and get people back to work. https://t.co/zmt8zx1H7z

While the COVID-19 pandemic continues to restrict demand on dairy and fresh potato products the @USDA’s surplus commodities purchase is welcome news for Idaho farmers and producers struggling to sell and distribute goods. https://t.co/876wVCTqEZ

Small businesses employ hundreds of thousands of Idahoans and #COVID-19 has made job security uncertain for many of our neighbors and friends. On Friday April 24th #SupportLocalGems and the Idahoans they employ by shopping online and supporting the gems in our communities. https://t.co/k1Y33T5oe3

The @FBI warns fraudsters are at work in Idaho with #COVID19-related scams. Be mindful and vigilant. Verify any contacts that try to sell you something or try to obtain your personal information. https://t.co/eFmqWjVkho

#GoodNews: Businesses in Idaho and across the country have shifted normal functions to help community neighbors during the #COVID19 crisis. Listen to @KBSX915 #IdahoMatters to learn more: https://t.co/JjeUtGsBIc

@SenatorRisch @RonWyden @SenJeffMerkley & I led a bipartisan group of 22 other senators on a letter calling for the Senate to finally provide much-needed financial certainty during the COVID-19 crisis for rural communities to ensure long-term funding needed for essential services

The @vasaltlakecity Suicide Prevention Team has set up daily Mental Health Clinic drop-in support conference calls during COVID-19. Everyday from 12-1pm call the following number 8007671750 code 42195. No Appointment needed. Supporting our veterans is crucial during these times https://t.co/V0rcJxdMHt

The CARES Act has provided a critical lifeline to individuals families and businesses across the US who have been devastated by the coronavirus pandemic. I am honored that @senatemajldr has trusted me to coordinate Senate oversight of its implementation. https://t.co/90MizlxG6g

Idaho’s dairy producers have not been immune to the economic strife felt across the nation throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. Congress and the Administration must continue to provide appropriate resources to ensure economic stability for the dairy industry. https://t.co/7OHEdKh54E

.@POTUS approval of @GovernorLittle’s disaster declaration request signals his & @VP’s commitment to Idahoans' safety. The declaration will provide additional resources to help Idaho state tribal & local governments engage in emergency protective measures to combat #COVID19
Today @USTreasury issued new guidance urging taxpayers to "Be On High Alert" for #coronavirus relief payment scams. Learn more here: https://t.co/v2wRVETUAh

The @DeptVetAffairs has extended financial benefits and claims relief to veterans amid its #COVID19 response. Those with questions can call 1-800-827-1000 or visit the VA’s website at: https://t.co/3DmjFwfz6p

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram a critical component of the #CARESAct is available starting today for small businesses. This program will deliver much-needed financial relief to small businesses across the country who have been affected by the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/jqC8NerTzx

Invasive and destructive scammers are taking advantage of the fears and concerns surrounding the coronavirus pandemic and using passage of the CARES Act to scam vulnerable individuals into providing personal or financial information.  (1/6) https://t.co/J5syodK2lh

Small Businesses are the energy and vision propelling our nation.  The @SBAgov is now offering low-interest federal disaster loans for working capital to Idaho small businesses suffering substantial economic injury as a result of COVID-19.  https://t.co/heYVonzKpf

Over the past week blood centers throughout the country have experienced a significant drop in donations due to #COVID19. If you're healthy your blood donation is needed. Today a few of my staff gave blood. Thank you to all the nurses and volunteers. We're all in this together https://t.co/fESnaPcioc

As Idaho confirms its first positive case of the coronavirus I pray for that individual’s speedy recovery. I will stay in close communication with @GovernorLittle to ensure Idaho has the resources necessary to continue being proactive to stop the spread of the virus.
